resource.chars:
an old black Viper or Adder, brought by one of ye company, upon ye wrist & Joint of ye thumb 
of ye right hand so yt drops of blood came out of ye 
wounds: he said yt he immediately felt a violent pain 
& shooting from ye wounds both to the top of his thumb 
& up his arm, even before ye Viper was loosen’d from 
his hand; soon after he felt a pain resembling that of 
burning trickle up his arm; in a few minutes his Eyes 
began to look red & fiery & to water much: in less 
than half an hour he perceived the venom sieze his 
heart with a pricking pain, <u>wch <\u> was attended with faint 
ness & shortness of breath, whereupon he fell into 
violent cold sweats: in a few minutes after this his 
belly began to swell <s>attended <\s> with great gripings, & 
pains in his back, <u>wch <\u> were attended with violent vo-
mitings & purgings: he told me yt during ye violence 
of these Symptoms his sight was gone twice for 
Severall minutes at a time, but yt he could hear all 
the while. He said yt in his former Experiments he had never 
deferr’d making use of his Remedy longer than when 
he perceived the effects of ye venom reaching his heart 
but this time being willing to satisfy ye company <s>coming after he had 
received of late, & describing of ye force of ye venom, were 
not satisfyed at seeing his Arm swell as much as is 
usual with ye sting of an Hornet, but would not suffer 
him<\s> thoro’ly, & trusting to 
the speedy effects of the <s>remedy <\s> oil <u>wch <\u> had never failed him when used in time he forbore to apply any thing till he <s>was so ill as to cry 
out for mercy, & yt even ye incredulous spectators began 
to think him in danger of his life.<\s> found him self ex-
ceeding ill & quite giddy.
